projects.name: 4.6 KM
projects.subtitle: Oslo Architecture Triennale
projects.teamMembers:
Team:
Direction and production: Alexander Auris
Cinematography: Anantha Krishnan
Assistant director: Britt Hatzius
Editor: Noemi Korthals Altes
Assitant of production: Pascal Buyse
Music: Arakaza
Animation: Diego Pachas
projects.description: Six queer people walk along a route that connects two different nei­ghborhoods in Brussels. They don’t know each other but share the city. They move, act, behave and use it in different ways. Through their eyes, we experience the spaces that the route connects. It is 4.6 km long and passes by the center of Brussels where a theater, a gay street, and a park are located.

projects.name: Prishtina
projects.subtitle: Kosovo Architecure Festival
projects.teamMembers:
Participants
VesaAlaj
RinaMuçaj
EdiBytyqi
AlbanotaHyseni
DjellzaBadalli
ErzaRama
ZanaBokshi
MarigonaDerguti
BlendBytyqi
Conducted by
AlexanderAuris
CarlosLanuza
projects.description:
This is the result of a workshop done in Prishtina between 16th and 18th September during the Kosovo Architecture Festival. It must be read as a exquisite corpse* in which new narratives were made from a queer perspective to talk about some of the Prishtina Public Archipelago buildings.
In order to develop the workshop it was taken into consideration experiences in the space to “queer the map”. So space becomes more a phenomenological platform; experiences and made-up stories are the excuse to convey architecture and the city as a place changing constantly.

projects.name: CAP LIMA
projects.subtitle: RENOVATION FOR DOCUMENTARY CENTER OF ARCHITECTURE
projects.teamMembers:
Team: 
Alexander Auris 
Leonie Van Bellingem
projects.description:
The project explores the role of Peruvian architecture in the contemporary social context and how this can be introduced to  an existing building designed 76 years ago. The CAP building is located on Tacna av. In this project, the architect Enrique Seoane, reflected on the cultural layers of Peruvian culture and its representation in architecture. Following this interest, our intervention is understood as the introduction of a new layer that represents the role of architecture today.
We understand contemporary architectural design in the Peruvian context as a tool for social inclusion, gathering and transmission of knowledge, and that it must recover the perception of citizenship in architecture as a necessary discipline for the socio-cultural development of the country. This way of seeing the architectural, together with the program proposed for the contest, allows this building to become a new benchmark for inclusion and architectural culture. For this, three strategies are proposed that allow flexibility, accessibility and at the same time maintain the spatial characteristics of the building.

projects.name: A performance
projects.subtitle: Summer Architecture Festival
projects.description: Time and progression of society allows us to question traditions and preconceived social constructs that seem natural ways of living. As a childish game, we revisit the places where we grew up and the moments in life that made us realize our own queerness. The house, the room or a piece of furniture remind us of these moments and through performance, we queer these artifacts and aim to celebrate the today and the possibilities for a queerer future.

projects.name: QUEER COMMONS
projects.subtitle: KU Leuven
projects.description:
This master thesis relates a community that is present in the city and society, a community that has been hidden for a while, but now it’s out there. The representation in the city of this community could be the gay neighborhoods, but this representation is problematic because they are not inclusive enough. The question of whether or not these spaces are commons starts a discussion about what is shared in queer people. What is really shared in queer people and how is it related to space?
The project reflects on this and states three levels of connection between queer people: the spheres. The analysis of these spheres are later presented in Berlin as a case study. The results of these analysis give variables and conditions for the development of the urban and
architectural project that is presented.

projects.name: LANDSCAPE IN MOVEMENT
projects.subtitle: Aarhus School of Architecture
projects.description: The creation of a new connection between Sealand and Jutland, does not onlly offers the possibility to reduce the commuting time, but it opens a new window to perceive the Danish territory. What would happen if the design of the line of the high speed train responded to the layers of the landscape and its perception? The project questions the line proposed by the Danish Transport Ministry and modifies it, creating regional and local changes that reduce the impact of the infrastructure in the landscape.

projects.name: SONIC SEQUENCES
projects.subtitle: Studio design
projects.description:
The project researches on the possbilitie of urban strategies through the experience on sonic mapping in Brussels.
The project focuses on the queality of sequentiality of sounds. Everyday life activities produce sounds that create
sequences and are settled i the urban space.
The project uses the residual green spaces and creates a new connection towards the canal with three different
interventions that connect to the green areas in a different perspective.

projects.name: SYMBIOSIS COWORKING
projects.teamMembers:
Collaboration with Roger Acosta
Structural Engineer: Erika Vicente Melendez
Contractor: Rafael Retis Iriarte
projects.description: Symbiosis coworking occupies a republican building made of adobe and quincha, traditional construction systems of Lima. The  project consisted on the reinforcement of the existing structure; the restauration of facade and interiors;  the implementation of a new set of common services for the future occupiers; and the design of furniture for the office spaces.

projects.name: IGNACIO MERINO MUSEUM
projects.description: The new museum Ignacio Merino is located inside the  Manrique Hospice, a restored republican building located in the Historic Center of Lima. It will exhibit the public collection of the Municipality of Lima, a collection of republican paintings and watercolors that have been unaccessible to the public.

projects.name: CONSTRUYE PARA CRECER
projects.subtitle: Honorable mention
projects.teamMembers:
Team:
Alexander Auris
Rodrigo Rengifo
Christian Saucedo
Julio Cesar Velarde
Roverto Villalobos
projects.description:
Iquitos is a city in the jungle of Peru. The climatic conditions and the quality of the land allow vegetation to grow naturally.
The urban growth nowadays has shorted this process, therefore the main objective of the project was to integrate productive spaces inside and out of the houses. The street of tree fruits and the park are the main productive public spaces in the project.It collects endemic trees and vegetations that also create an olfactory experience. the design of the houses occupy less the the half of the total area of each unit, so people can have their own garden.

projects.name: REFLECTIONS FROM THE BUS
projects.description: ... . Everyday a friend from my family (Mario) picked me and three other kids up and took us to school. He always did it in the same order and took us to each school also in the same order. I had to be awake, with breakfast and of course all my homework done in order to go to school. One day, Mario took me to school, but I was worried that I hadn’t done the homework so when I was about to cross the door of the school, I stepped back and thought for a moment what to do. I decided that it was a good idea to skip school and go back home… and so I did.

projects.name: QUEER COMMONS
projects.description: Queer people, we are individuals with something in common. Can this common aspect of ourselves be related to architecture? And can this aspect create a sense of community? Being queer is not a condition of a place, it is a condition of human existence. It is intersectional. How can sexuality, as a reflection, as a subversive act, as a political attitude and as a human condition and need, makes us create the sense of place and belonging? This research analyses three spheres: the affective, the politic and the XXXXX in relation to the sense of belonging and constructing a common space.
